unnormalised: New dengue cases are popping up all over Delhi, esp. in areas like Rohini and Pitampura. The MCD is saying they're doing fogging and awareness drives, but tbh, it doesn't seem like enough. My neighbour, Mrs. Sharma, had it last month and she was really unwell. Needed to be hospitalized for 3 days at Fortis.
normalised: New dengue cases are popping up all over Delhi, especially in areas like Rohini and Pitampura. The M-C-D is saying they are doing fogging and awareness drives, but to be honest, it does not seem like enough. My neighbour, Missus Sharma, had it last month and she was really unwell. Needed to be hospitalized for three days at Fortis.

unnormalised: Apparently, the no. of cases this year is already 2x higher than last year at this time! Experts are blaming the early monsoon and stagnant water everywhere. Plus, people aren't really taking precautions. You see so many kids playing outside in the evenings with no mosquito repellent!
normalised: Apparently, the number of cases this year is already two times higher than last year at this time! Experts are blaming the early monsoon and stagnant water everywhere. Plus, people are not really taking precautions. You see so many kids playing outside in the evenings with no mosquito repellent!

unnormalised: The health ministry is advising everyone to keep their surroundings clean and use mosquito nets. They've also got teams going door-to-door checking for breeding spots. But honestly, it’s everyone's responsibility to stay safe. Don’t wait for the govt to do everything!
normalised: The health ministry is advising everyone to keep their surroundings clean and use mosquito nets. They have also got teams going door to door checking for breeding spots. But honestly, it is everyone's responsibility to stay safe. Do not wait for the government to do everything!

unnormalised: So, peeps, please be careful out there! Use mosquito repellent (like Odomos), wear full-sleeved clothes, and don't let water accumulate around your homes. And if you get a fever, go see Dr. Gupta at Max Hospital ASAP. Better safe than sorry, right?
normalised: So, peeps, please be careful out there! Use mosquito repellent like Odomos, wear full sleeved clothes, and do not let water accumulate around your homes. And if you get a fever, go see Doctor Gupta at Max Hospital as soon as possible. Better safe than sorry, right?
